intro: Restio monanthos, commonly known as the single-flowered restia, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal and sandy habitats. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and a flowering spike that bears a single, small, white or pale blue flower. Restio monanthos is often found in fynbos vegetation, where it contributes to the region's biodiversity. Its structure and growth habits make it well adapted to the harsh, nutrient-poor conditions of its native environment.
